children.subject:
From my own experience working with a PhD student in RISE lab, research is pretty informal, it is mainly contributing code to repos/having 1-3 meetings a week. I believe as long as you have access to your berkeley.edu email it should be fine as depending on the research you would need to access resources like AWS or lab machines (which I think the research group would give you access to through your berkeley.edu email).

The main issue is probably that you won't have keycard access to Soda but if you are interning then you can probably do remote meetings instead.

history.content:
I'm going to be taking a semester off to do an internship in the Spring. Will I be able to participate in research without being enrolled? 

I emailed URAP and they require me to be registered. Does anyone know if I'll be able to get research in general, without being registered for the semester?

Any help would be much appreciated :)
history.subject: Research without being registered?
